channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Biggest Military Funding Bill Still Allows Promoting Soldiers By Race And Sex
item.description: Sound legislation, not gaslighting, is needed to end identity preferences and restore merit in personnel policy.

item.title: Jimmy Lai’s Sham Conviction in Hong Kong
item.description: There may now be a new opportunity to press for his freedom.

item.title: No Heroes in the Oklahoma Grading Controversy
item.description: There’s only one relevant question in a University of Oklahoma probe into a failing grade that became a national story.

item.title: Donald Trump Jr., Bettina Anderson announce engagement at White House holiday party
item.description: The announcement of Donald Trump Jr. and Palm Beach socialite Bettina Anderson's engagement rang through the White House walls Monday night.

item.title: Wisconsin Supreme Court Ends Democrat AG’s Bid To ‘Defy’ SCOTUS’ Catholic Charity Ruling
item.description: 'You’d think Wisconsin would take a 9-0 Supreme Court loss as a hint to stop digging,' said Becket Fund attorney Eric Rassbach.

item.title: The Federalist’s Notable Books Of 2025
item.description: Seasons greetings! It's time for another exciting and sprawling books recommendation column.

item.title: Australia’s Dangerous Naïveté
item.description: The atrocity at Bondi Beach was heartrending and all too predictable.

item.title: Jimmy Lai’s Criminal Conviction Is What Democracy Dying In Darkness Actually Looks Like
item.description: Jimmy Lai's courage is something America's propaganda media could only dream of possessing.

item.title: Judge Rules Wisconsin Show Trial Against Trump Allies Will Go On
item.description: Far-left Attorney General Brad Kaul brought charges against three defendants in what many see as a proxy trial aimed at President Trump.

item.title: ‘But Your iPhone’ Conservatism Will Fail
item.description: We must acknowledge that the badges of middle-class life have become harder to achieve, no matter our technological advances.
